[h1]The cake is a lie[/h1]

The portal is a game by Valve studio, which premiered in 2007.

At the beginning of the game we wake up in a mysterious room and are controlled by a mysterious voice. Along with the story we discover new possibilities, such as portal gun, thanks to which we can create portals and move between the following rooms. Each level requires us to think logically without which we are not able to move on. In addition to the main story, we have advanced maps and challenges that are really difficult.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

The graphics are simple, but also pleasant. Although the rooms look similar, it is done on purpose, with the plot in mind. It doesn't matter much during the game.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

There's not much to talk about in-game sounds either, because there aren't many, and the ones that are, are good. I liked the most the dialogues that a mysterious voice leads with us.

[h1]Summary[/h1]

The portal is one of the best puzzle games I've played. Although the story is short, it brought me a lot of fun. After 13 years since its premiere the game is still on a high level. We have additional maps, which are quite a challenge. The game is very cheap, and it often happens that it is on sale. I think that the Portal is a game that should be available for everyone in the library. Just a masterpiece.

A good first-person puzzle platformer. At least half of the game is pure puzzle-solving ("testing") with the tests getting  increasingly difficult at a rate which the player still does not get overwhelmed. The rest of the game is using everything you've learned to go through a final gauntlet. The atmosphere is expertly crafted. It remains simple narratively.
Very innovative concept, very fun to speedrun :P

V社的传家之作，充满想象力的解谜方式和充满空间感的操作方式很容易吸引一批玩家投入其中。
用了3小时左右的时间完成了基本主线内容，也尝试玩了一些挑战地图。这些让我觉得，解谜的方式、速度、精准度，或者是新奇的想法，是对游戏内容的进一步拓展，这一些内容有待玩家自己去开发了，总而言之，是个值得一玩的游戏。
